name: Lacosamide (Vimpat)
summary: An anticonvulsant primarily used for partial-onset seizures, sometimes used off-label in psychiatry for mood stabilization.
description: Lacosamide is an anticonvulsant that selectively enhances slow inactivation of voltage-gated sodium channels, stabilizing hyperexcitable neuronal membranes and inhibiting repetitive neuronal firing. It is FDA-approved for the treatment of partial-onset seizures and primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures. In psychiatry, it has limited but emerging off-label use for mood stabilization in bipolar disorder and adjunctive therapy in treatment-resistant cases.

contraindications: Known second- or third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block without pacemaker
monitoring_required: ECG in patients with conduction abnormalities

sections.text: Enhances slow inactivation of voltage-gated sodium channels, reducing repetitive neuronal firing without affecting fast inactivation.

adult.partial_onset_seizures: Start 50 mg twice daily; increase by 100 mg/day weekly to 200–400 mg/day in two divided doses
adult.iv_dosing: Same total daily dose as oral, administered over 30–60 minutes

sections.geriatric: No adjustment unless renal/hepatic impairment present
sections.hepatic_impairment: Max 300 mg/day in mild/moderate impairment; not recommended in severe impairment
sections.renal_impairment: Reduce max dose to 300 mg/day in severe impairment

sections.text: Onset of antiepileptic effect within days; steady state reached in 3 days.

other: Avoid abrupt discontinuation to reduce risk of seizures

items: ECG at baseline in patients with cardiac conduction issues

sections.pregnancy: Limited data; weigh benefits vs risks
sections.pediatrics: Approved for children ≥4 years for partial-onset seizures
sections.geriatrics: No specific issues beyond comorbidity considerations

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over at least 1 week to minimize risk of increased seizure frequency.

items: Generally well tolerated; dizziness is most common adverse effect
Monitor adherence carefully in psychiatric off-label use

seo.description: Lacosamide (Vimpat) is an anticonvulsant for partial-onset and generalized seizures, sometimes used off-label for mood stabilization.
